alert.note: Alert for Lower Connecticut Valley South; Southern Taconics (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 3:07AM EDT until April 11 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS IN SOUTHERN VERMONT... The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 8 PM EDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 036 Southern Taconics and Fire Weather Zone 038 Lower Connecticut Valley South. * Winds...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...20 to 30 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid to upper 60s. * IMPACTS...Dry vegetation combined with gusty winds and low RH will promote the potential for rapid fire spread with any fires that may start.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Lower Connecticut Valley South; Southern Taconics
